text: You arrive at a UN outpost in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. A UN ambassador approaches you.
response: Welcome to India, sir. It's good that you've finally arrived. As you know, about 40% of Indians don't have access to clean water and as a result around 37.7 million Indians get sick from waterborne diseases. Furthermore, field crops suffer from poor yields. In an effort to alleviate these problems, you have two objectives. One is located to the north of us and the other - to the south. Let me tell you about them.
options: 1. Ask about the mission to the north. 2. Ask about the mission to the south

opt1.response: The village of Kaithi. The locals there are struggling because of the non-functional sewage treatment plant. You see, when the waste water does not get processed and filtered, it gets sent to the Ganges river polluted. Therefore the industrial and human waste that gets leaked into the river leads to the population getting sick or dying due to the lack of clean water and sanitation.
opt1.options: 1. Ask how the locals are handling the situation. 2. Tell him to get to the point.

opt1.text: Have the locals found an alternative way to acquire clean water?
opt1.response: Not at all. Their only choices are to drink contaminated water or die of thirst. There is another option - drinking from underground springs. However, it is not applicable in this village.
opt1.options: 1. Ask him why the third option wouldn't work. 2. Ask him what you need to do.

opt1.response: Because there is no groundwater in the area. Nowadays the clean water that the Indians have access to usually comes from underground and the ones who don't have such sources are left with the filth from the rivers.
opt1.options: 1. Ask him what you need to do.

opt1.response: You're to go to the sewage treatment plant and restore it to working condition.

opt1.text: Alright, what about the second mission?
opt1.response: Due to the overprivatization of underground springs, there aren't enough left to support India's crop fields. Your mission is to find an underground water source. We believe that one is located just below the crop field that is to the south. When you find it, you have to install a drip irrigation system which allows for minimal usage of water while effectively soaking the crops. After all, this is what we're trying to avoid here - the unneccessary consumption of water.
opt1.options: 1. Acknowledge the information.  2. Ask him what repercussions there are from the lack of underground springs.

opt1.text: OK, I think I have everything I need. I better get to work.

opt2.text: What effect does the lack of underground water sources have on the people.
opt2.response: Well, if the crop fields don't have proper irrigation systems set up, the farmers will have to rely on seasonal rains. That always leads to a bad yield. So ultimately, with no irrigation comes hunger.
